attributes.action: Limit the brightness of LED headlights on vehicles
attributes.additional_details: Most motorists find LED headlights on oncoming cars too bright, and they blind drivers.  They can cause migraines and cause night blindness.  They are dangerous and will cause accidents.
attributes.background: Headlight brightness limits are based on the wattage of incandescent bulbs.  Regulations should limit brightness based on lumens instead.  LED headlight brightness should be limited to 700 lumens for low-beam, and 1200 lumens for high-beams, which is the brightness of halogen headlights.

rejection.details: You may wish to sign this petition which calls for the same action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/711112
